children.text: Position Vector: If A is a point with coordinates (x, y, z), then position vector \(\vec{OA} = x\hat{i} + y\hat{j} + z\hat{k}\) where O is the origin.
Magnitude of Vector: For vector \(\vec{a} = a_1\hat{i} + a_2\hat{j} + a_3\hat{k}\), magnitude is \(|\vec{a}| = \sqrt{a_1^2 + a_2^2 + a_3^2}\)
Unit Vector: Unit vector in direction of \(\vec{a}\) is \(\hat{a} = \frac{\vec{a}}{|\vec{a}|}\). Unit vectors along coordinate axes are \(\hat{i}, \hat{j}, \hat{k}\).
Vector Addition: \(\vec{a} + \vec{b} = (a_1 + b_1)\hat{i} + (a_2 + b_2)\hat{j} + (a_3 + b_3)\hat{k}\). Addition is commutative: \(\vec{a} + \vec{b} = \vec{b} + \vec{a}\)
Scalar Multiplication: For scalar k and vector \(\vec{a}\), \(k\vec{a} = ka_1\hat{i} + ka_2\hat{j} + ka_3\hat{k}\). Magnitude becomes \(|k\vec{a}| = |k||\vec{a}|\)
Dot Product: \(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = a_1b_1 + a_2b_2 + a_3b_3 = |\vec{a}||\vec{b}|\cos\theta\) where \(\theta\) is angle between vectors.

Cross Product: \(\vec{a} \times \vec{b} = \begin{vmatrix} \hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \\ a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3 \end{vmatrix} = (a_2b_3 - a_3b_2)\hat{i} - (a_1b_3 - a_3b_1)\hat{j} + (a_1b_2 - a_2b_1)\hat{k}\)
Cross Product Properties: \(|\vec{a} \times \vec{b}| = |\vec{a}||\vec{b}|\sin\theta\). Cross product is anti-commutative: \(\vec{a} \times \vec{b} = -\vec{b} \times \vec{a}\)
Section Formula: Position vector of point dividing line segment joining points A and B internally in ratio m:n is \(\vec{r} = \frac{n\vec{a} + m\vec{b}}{m + n}\)

Scalar Triple Product: \([\vec{a} \vec{b} \vec{c}] = \vec{a} \cdot (\vec{b} \times \vec{c}) = \begin{vmatrix} a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3 \\ c_1 & c_2 & c_3 \end{vmatrix}\). Represents volume of parallelepiped.
Vector Triple Product: \(\vec{a} \times (\vec{b} \times \vec{c}) = \vec{b}(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{c}) - \vec{c}(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b})\). This is the BAC-CAB rule.
Condition for Collinearity: Three points A, B, C are collinear if \(\vec{AB} \times \vec{AC} = \vec{0}\) or \(\vec{AB} = k\vec{AC}\) for some scalar k.
Condition for Coplanarity: Four points A, B, C, D are coplanar if \([\vec{AB} \vec{AC} \vec{AD}] = 0\) or scalar triple product is zero.
